snippet: A Nepali immigrant who led expeditions to Mt. Everest now speaks Yiddish in Manhattan.
abstract: A Nepali immigrant who led expeditions to Mt. Everest now speaks Yiddish in Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: “I never even know what electricity was, never saw it, until I was in my 20s,” Chhapte Sherpa, 39, who grew up in a tiny village in the Himalayas in Nepal, now an assistant manager at Russ & Daughters, the popular lox purveyor on Houston Street, told Corey Kilgannon.

headline.main: The Lox Sherpa of Russ and Daughters
